thread.title_full: Perfect nights sleep - Review of Pullman Paris Centre - Bercy, Paris, France - TripAdvisor

author: Pro-Travel-Buyer
title: Perfect nights sleep
text:
I've stayed in the Pullman Bercy twice over the past 12 months, on both occasions for business but this hotel I would also gladly stay for a city break holiday or leisure weekend. Try to book to include the Thursday night as the hotel has a ´afterwork' event open to all guests, there is a DJ and different things, on this occasion a nail bar free for the ladies (and men) , a pop up barbershop to trim your beard, old style shoe shine and a dim sum cart supplying free finger food to accompany the cocktails you can order at the bar.
Last night I stayed in the Junior suite room, 720 on the 7th floor overlooking the seine river. I enjoyed using the separate work area of the junior suite to catch up on emails before going out to my works evening , leaving my partner to order room service (didn't want to use the great restaurant on her own) . Apparently the burger was very good with side of salad and chips.
I came back late and experienced a perfect nights sleep in the king size bed, they are just like the sofitel my beds. Rain shower in the large bathroom in the morning , gets you ready for the day.
Breakfast according to TripAdvisor was voted the best in Europe, it was very good with a large selection of breads, pâtisseries, crêpes, pikelets, cheeses, cold meats, hot food etc, excellent warm service from the waiting staff. They even have a juice extractor to make your own juice, I failed on this task and should have asked for help.
Definitely this hotel should be on your top priority lists to book when in Paris, the automatic metro line 14 is 2 mins walk away (stop cours st emilion) so no strikes on this one!!
